title: Tech
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Tech, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: How Elon Musk Won His No Good, Very Bad Year
items.description: The billionaire’s involvement with the Trump administration and DOGE had deep impacts on Tesla’s bottom line. But Elon Musk was still able to turn his...

items.title: The Future of EVs Is Foggy—but California Still Wants More of Them
items.description: Hamstrung by lawsuits, the state can’t officially keep its goal to ban new gas-powered car sales by 2035. But it’s going to keep trying.

items.title: TikTok Shop launches digital gift cards to challenge Amazon and eBay
items.description: TikTok Shop has rolled out a new feature that allows users to purchase digital gift cards, making it easier to help friends and family buy from the mi...

items.title: Politics Is Fandom; Fascism Is Fanfic
items.description: From Zohran Mamdani’s campaign to the US government’s Halo memes, fandom has become the defining language of US politics.

items.title: Waymo resumes service in San Francisco after robotaxis stall during blackout
items.description: Waymo suspended its SF robotaxi service on Saturday evening after a massive blackout appeared to leave many of its vehicles stalled on city streets.

items.title: Brain Gear Is the Hot New Wearable
items.description: Smartwatches are cool and all, but have you considered wearable neurotech?

items.title: ChatGPT: Everything you need to know about the AI-powered chatbot
items.description: A timeline of ChatGPT product updates and releases, starting with the latest, which we’ve been updating throughout the year.

items.title: Tech Disrupted Friendship. It’s Time to Bring It Back
items.description: Two decades ago social media promised to connect people with pals far and wide. Twenty years online has left us turning to AI for kinship. IRL compani...

items.title: A comprehensive list of 2025 tech layoffs
items.description: A complete list of all the known layoffs in tech, from Big Tech to startups, broken down by month throughout 2025.

items.title: A rough week for hardware companies
items.description: iRobot, Luminar, and Rad Power Bikes were very different companies, but they faced some similar challenges.
